title: Escaping the Tutorial Hell: How I Took Control of My Learning
description: Spending countless hours on tutorial after tutorial but still feeling lost? I’ve been there. Here’s how I broke free from the cycle and started building projects that actually taught me something...

title: Impostor Syndrome in Coding: Why You’re Not a Fraud
description: Every developer, from juniors to seniors, experiences impostor syndrome. This is my story of overcoming self-doubt and learning to embrace the journey instead of comparing myself to others.

title: Debugging Nightmares: How to Stay Sane When Nothing Works
description: Staring at an error message for hours can be frustrating. Here are my favorite debugging strategies and mindset shifts that helped me become a more confident problem-solver.

title: JavaScript: The Language I Loved to Hate (At First)
description: My initial experience with JavaScript was full of confusion and frustration. But over time, I learned to appreciate its quirks. Here’s what changed my mind.

title: CSS Grid vs. Flexbox: Which One Should You Use?
description: Both CSS Grid and Flexbox are powerful layout tools, but when should you use one over the other? Let’s break down their strengths and ideal use cases.

title: The Day I Deployed My First Website
description: Deployment is often overlooked in tutorials, but it’s a crucial skill. Here’s what I wish I had known before pushing my first project live.
